CARDINAL . In GPE , although it is possible to obtain under certain conditions a decree of nullity - a declaration by ORG that a marriage was null and void ab initio - , divorce in the sense of dissolution of a marriage does not exist . In fact , LAW provides : " No law shall be enacted providing for the grant of a dissolution of marriage . "

However , spouses may be relieved from the duty of cohabiting either by a legally binding deed of separation concluded between them or by a court decree of judicial separation ( also known as a divorce a mensa et thoro ) . Such a decree has no effect on the existence of the marriage in law . It can be granted only if the petitioner furnishes evidence proving CARDINAL of CARDINAL specified matrimonial offences , namely , adultery , cruelty or unnatural practices . The parties will call and examine witnesses on this point .
By virtue of LAW , an individual against whom a decree of judicial separation is granted forfeits certain succession rights over his or her spouse ’s estate .

CARDINAL . Decrees of judicial separation are obtainable only in ORG . The parties may conduct their case in person . However , the ORG ’s replies to questions put by ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) reveal that in each of the CARDINAL separation proceedings initiated in GPE in the period from DATE , without exception , the petitioner was represented by a lawyer .

In its report of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG noted that the approximate range of the costs incurred by a legally represented petitioner was £ CARDINAL - £ CARDINAL in an uncontested action and MONEY CARDINAL in a contested action , the exact amount depending on such factors as the number of witnesses and the complexity of the issues involved . In the case of a successful petition by a wife , the general rule is that the husband will be ordered to pay all costs reasonably and properly incurred by her , the precise figure being fixed by a Taxing Master .

Legal aid is not at present available in GPE for the purpose of seeking a judicial separation , nor indeed for any civil matters . In DATE , ORG was established under the chairmanship of Mr. Justice Pringle . It reported to the Government in DATE , recommending the introduction of a comprehensive scheme of legal aid and advice in this area . At the hearings on DATE , counsel for the Government informed the ORG that the ORG had decided in principle to introduce legal aid in family - law matters and that it was hoped to have the necessary measures taken before DATE .
